title.narrative: Integrated Emergency support Project for flood affected children in Luuq and Bardera Districts of Gedo Region CSZ.

description.narrative:
In order to address the protection risks and vulnerabilities due to the current flooding and ongoing conflict, SEDHURO will prioritise the following Child Protection and GBV integrated activities for flood affected areas.
1.Promote Safety and Wellbeing: Psychosocial support will be provided to children and caregivers to protect and promote children’s wellbeing and full participation. Psychosocial support will focus on engagement of children, caregivers and families through restoring, strengthening and mobilising family and community systems to strength their resilience to recover from the impact of the floods - The specific psychosocial activities will be based on the IASC MHPSS intervention pyramid whilst ensuring functional referrals up and down the layers of the pyramid. Various interventions across layers of the pyramid will provide a holistic approach to strengthen the innate capacity of children, the capacities of their caregivers and communities to support their wellbeing and protection. - Child Friendly Spaces will provide structured and unstructured community based-psychosocial support. Lifesaving on preventing violence, protecting against family separation
Protect unaccompanied and separated children by providing them with immediate care, referrals and family tracing and reunification services. - Identification, documentation, family tracing and reunification for unaccompanied and separated children. The vulnerabilities of separated children will be assessed based on the individual circumstances of each child including the type of separation (voluntary or accidental), the duration of separation (during displacement or prior to drought), contact arrangements, the suitability of care arrangements, child’s age, gender, children with disabilities and the child’s best interests. Following this assessment an appropriate care plan will be developed. - Case management process will be initiated for all unaccompanied children, including provision of interim family–based care, family tracing and reunification - Individualised support through case management will be provided to vulnerable children at risk of hazardous child labour, trafficking, violence and exploitation Establish referral system in schools/TLS and community based Child Protection Mechanisms for quick and efficient referrals of children with protection needs. This includes training, mapping of services and focal points within community and school (community child protection committees, School Management Committees, etc.). Provision of gender based violence comprehensive support to boys, girls and women which includes the provision of GBV service package (medical, psychosocial support, legal aid and distribution of dignity kits).
3. Sustainability: Refresher/training to teachers and community based child protection committees on child protection and psychosocial support, and enable them to identify and refer cases of children in need of protection Strengthen Coordination and preparedness capacities of Child Protection actors for effective response during floods and other emergencies
